description: Extending the commute trip reduction tax credit.

original.text:
H-0089.1
HOUSE BILL 1043
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Wylie, Doglio, Fey, Ramel, Shavers, Fosse, Salahuddin, Reeves, and Hill
Prefiled 12/11/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Finance.
AN ACT Relating to commute trip reduction tax credit; amending RCW 82.70.020, 82.70.040, and 82.70.900; creating a new section; providing an effective date; and declaring an emergency.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
Sec. 1. RCW 82.70.020 and 2024 c 310 s 608 are each amended to read as follows:
(1) Employers in this state who are taxable under chapter 82.04 or 82.16 RCW and provide financial incentives to their own or other employees for ride sharing, for using public transportation, for using car sharing, or for using nonmotorized commuting before January 1, ((2025))2035, are allowed a credit against taxes payable under chapters 82.04 and 82.16 RCW for amounts paid to or on behalf of employees for ride sharing in vehicles carrying two or more persons, for using public transportation, for using car sharing, or for using nonmotorized commuting, not to exceed (($60))$100 per employee per fiscal year.
(2) Property managers who are taxable under chapter 82.04 or 82.16 RCW and provide financial incentives to persons employed at a worksite in this state managed by the property manager for ride sharing, for using public transportation, for using car sharing, or for using nonmotorized commuting before January 1, ((2024))2035, are allowed a credit against taxes payable under chapters 82.04 and 82.16 RCW for amounts paid to or on behalf of these persons for ride sharing in vehicles carrying two or more persons, for using public transportation, for using car sharing, or for using nonmotorized commuting, not to exceed (($60))$100 per person per fiscal year.
(3) The credit under this section is equal to the amount paid to or on behalf of each employee multiplied by 50 percent, but may not exceed (($60))$100 per employee per fiscal year. No refunds may be granted for credits under this section.
(4) A person may not receive credit under this section for amounts paid to or on behalf of the same employee under both chapters 82.04 and 82.16 RCW.
(5) A person may not take a credit under this section for amounts claimed for credit by other persons.
Sec. 2. RCW 82.70.040 and 2024 c 310 s 609 are each amended to read as follows:
(1)(a) The department must keep a running total of all credits allowed under RCW 82.70.020 during each fiscal year. The department may not allow any credits that would cause the total amount allowed to exceed (($2,750,000))$4,300,000 in any fiscal year.
(b) If the total amount of credit applied for by all applicants in any year exceeds the limit in this subsection, the department must ratably reduce the amount of credit allowed for all applicants so that the limit in this subsection is not exceeded. If a credit is reduced under this subsection, the amount of the reduction may not be carried forward and claimed in subsequent fiscal years.
(2)(a) Tax credits under RCW 82.70.020 may not be claimed in excess of the amount of tax otherwise due under chapter 82.04 or 82.16 RCW.
(b) Through June 30, 2005, a person with taxes equal to or in excess of the credit under RCW 82.70.020, and therefore not subject to the limitation in (a) of this subsection, may elect to defer tax credits for a period of not more than three years after the year in which the credits accrue. For credits approved by the department through June 30, 2015, the approved credit may be carried forward and used for tax reporting periods through December 31, 2016. Credits approved after June 30, 2015, must be used for tax reporting periods within the calendar year for which they are approved by the department and may not be carried forward to subsequent tax reporting periods. Credits carried forward as authorized by this subsection are subject to the limitation in subsection (1)(a) of this section for the fiscal year for which the credits were originally approved.
(3) No person may be approved for tax credits under RCW 82.70.020 in excess of (($100,000))$50,000 in any fiscal year. This limitation does not apply to credits carried forward from prior years under subsection (2)(b) of this section.
(4) No person may claim tax credits after June 30, ((2025))2035.
Sec. 3. RCW 82.70.900 and 2024 c 310 s 610 are each amended to read as follows:
This chapter expires July 1, ((2025))2035.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 4. RCW 82.32.808 does not apply to this act.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 5. This act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, or support of the state government and its existing public institutions, and takes effect July 1, 2025.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The purpose of House Bill 1043 is to amend existing laws concerning the commute trip reduction tax credit in Washington state. The key amendments include extending the expiration date of the tax credit program from 2025 to 2035 and increasing the maximum credit amount from $60 to $100 per employee. This bill aims to encourage employers and property managers to provide financial incentives for employees to use alternative commuting methods, helping to reduce traffic congestion and promote environmentally friendly transportation options.

Key Provisions

Tax Credit for Employers

  • Employers providing financial incentives for actions such as ride sharing, public transportation, or non-motorized commuting will receive a tax credit.
  • The credit amount is set at $100 per employee per fiscal year, increased from the previous amount of $60.
  • The credit represents 50% of the money spent on the eligible programs but cannot exceed $100 per employee per fiscal year.
  • No refunds for credits will be allowed, and individuals cannot claim credit for the same employee under multiple tax categories.

Property Manager Tax Credit

  • Property managers who incentivize their employees in similar ways are also eligible for a tax credit of $100 per employee per fiscal year.

Credit Limits and Management

  • The total amount of tax credits allowed per fiscal year is capped at $4,300,000, which is an increase from the previous limit of $2,750,000.
  • If claims exceed the cap, the credit offered to each applicant will be reduced proportionately.
  • Individuals cannot claim credits beyond the taxes due under the relevant tax chapters.

Expiration and Transition

  • The program's expiration date has been extended from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2035.
  • Clarification that RCW 82.32.808 does not apply to this act.

Effective Date

  • The act is declared an emergency and takes effect on July 1, 2025.

subDocuments.name: 1043-S
subDocuments.description: Substitute House Bill 1043 as Recommended by Finance

original.text:
H-1445.3
SUBSTITUTE HOUSE BILL 1043
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByHouse Finance (originally sponsored by Representatives Wylie, Doglio, Fey, Ramel, Shavers, Fosse, Salahuddin, Reeves, and Hill)
READ FIRST TIME 02/26/25.
AN ACT Relating to commute trip reduction tax credit; amending RCW 82.70.020, 82.70.040, and 82.70.900; creating a new section; providing an effective date; and declaring an emergency.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
Sec. 1. RCW 82.70.020 and 2024 c 310 s 608 are each amended to read as follows:
(1) Employers in this state who are taxable under chapter 82.04 or 82.16 RCW and provide financial incentives to their own or other employees for ride sharing, for using public transportation, for using car sharing, or for using nonmotorized commuting before January 1, ((2025))2035, are allowed a credit against taxes payable under chapters 82.04 and 82.16 RCW for amounts paid to or on behalf of employees for ride sharing in vehicles carrying two or more persons, for using public transportation, for using car sharing, or for using nonmotorized commuting, not to exceed $60 per employee per fiscal year.
(2) Property managers who are taxable under chapter 82.04 or 82.16 RCW and provide financial incentives to persons employed at a worksite in this state managed by the property manager for ride sharing, for using public transportation, for using car sharing, or for using nonmotorized commuting before January 1, ((2024))2035, are allowed a credit against taxes payable under chapters 82.04 and 82.16 RCW for amounts paid to or on behalf of these persons for ride sharing in vehicles carrying two or more persons, for using public transportation, for using car sharing, or for using nonmotorized commuting, not to exceed $60 per person per fiscal year.
(3) The credit under this section is equal to the amount paid to or on behalf of each employee ((multiplied by 50 percent)), but may not exceed $60 per employee per fiscal year. No refunds may be granted for credits under this section.
(4) A person may not receive credit under this section for amounts paid to or on behalf of the same employee under both chapters 82.04 and 82.16 RCW.
(5) A person may not take a credit under this section for amounts claimed for credit by other persons.
Sec. 2. RCW 82.70.040 and 2024 c 310 s 609 are each amended to read as follows:
(1)(a) The department must keep a running total of all credits allowed under RCW 82.70.020 during each fiscal year. The department may not allow any credits that would cause the total amount allowed to exceed $2,750,000 in any fiscal year.
(b) If the total amount of credit applied for by all applicants in any year exceeds the limit in this subsection, the department must ratably reduce the amount of credit allowed for all applicants so that the limit in this subsection is not exceeded. If a credit is reduced under this subsection, the amount of the reduction may not be carried forward and claimed in subsequent fiscal years.
(2)(a) Tax credits under RCW 82.70.020 may not be claimed in excess of the amount of tax otherwise due under chapter 82.04 or 82.16 RCW.
(b) Through June 30, 2005, a person with taxes equal to or in excess of the credit under RCW 82.70.020, and therefore not subject to the limitation in (a) of this subsection, may elect to defer tax credits for a period of not more than three years after the year in which the credits accrue. For credits approved by the department through June 30, 2015, the approved credit may be carried forward and used for tax reporting periods through December 31, 2016. Credits approved after June 30, 2015, must be used for tax reporting periods within the calendar year for which they are approved by the department and may not be carried forward to subsequent tax reporting periods. Credits carried forward as authorized by this subsection are subject to the limitation in subsection (1)(a) of this section for the fiscal year for which the credits were originally approved.
(3) No person may be approved for tax credits under RCW 82.70.020 in excess of (($100,000))$50,000 in any fiscal year. This limitation does not apply to credits carried forward from prior years under subsection (2)(b) of this section.
(4) No person may claim tax credits after June 30, ((2025))2035.
Sec. 3. RCW 82.70.900 and 2024 c 310 s 610 are each amended to read as follows:
This chapter expires July 1, ((2025))2035.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 4. RCW 82.32.808 does not apply to this act.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 5. This act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, or support of the state government and its existing public institutions, and takes effect July 1, 2025.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The edits made to the proposed legislation primarily aim to update the enforcement and eligibility criteria for the commute trip reduction tax credit. These changes are intended to extend the credit eligibility deadline and adjust the limits on the amounts taxpayers can claim. The revised bill is designed to encourage more companies and property managers to promote sustainable commuting options, helping to reduce traffic congestion and environmental impact.

Key Changes

Credit Eligibility and Amounts

  • Employers are allowed a tax credit for financial incentives given to employees for ride sharing and other forms of commuting until January 1, 2035 (previously 2025).
  • Property managers also have the same extended credit eligibility until January 1, 2035 (previously 2024).
  • The maximum credit amount has been increased from $60 to $100 per employee and per fiscal year.

Credit Calculation

  • The previous method of calculating the credit, which involved multiplying the amount paid by 50%, has been removed (now it directly reflects the amount paid up to the limit).
  • There is no provision for granting refunds on the credits taken.

Annual Credit Cap

  • The annual cap for total credits allowed has changed from $2,750,000 to $4,300,000.
  • The maximum credit that an individual can claim in any fiscal year has been reduced from $100,000 to $50,000.

Expiration Date

  • The entire chapter now expires on July 1, 2035, instead of 2025.

Administrative Provisions

  • The department responsible for administering the credits must maintain a running total of credits claimed, ensuring they do not exceed the newly established limits.

Overall, these amendments are intended to broaden the scope of the tax credit, encourage more participation from businesses in supporting sustainable commuting practices, and streamline the administration of these credits.

keywords.text: commute trip reduction tax credit extension employers property managers ride sharing public transportation non-motorized commuting traffic congestion environmental transportation incentives credit limits
